verses.verse: For Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> will have compassion <S%H7355><s%> on Jacob <S%H3290><s%>, and will yet choose <S%H977><s%> Israel <S%H3478><s%>, and set <S%H3240><s%> them in their own land <S%H127><s%>: and the sojourner <S%H1616><s%> shall join <S%H3867><s%> himself with them <S%H5596><s%>, and they shall cleave to the house <S%H1004><s%> of Jacob <S%H3290><s%>.

And the peoples <S%H5971><s%> shall take <S%H3947><s%> them <S%H935><s%>, and bring them to their place <S%H4725><s%>; and the house <S%H1004><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> shall possess <S%H5157><s%> them in the land <S%H127><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> for servants <S%H5650><s%> and for handmaids <S%H8198><s%>: and they shall take them captive <S%H7617><s%> whose captives <S%H7617><s%> they were <S%H7287><s%>; and they shall rule over their oppressors <S%H5065><s%>.

And it shall come to pass in the day <S%H3117><s%> that Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> shall give thee rest <S%H5117><s%> from thy sorrow <S%H6090><s%>, and from thy trouble <S%H6090><s%>, and from the hard <S%H7186><s%> service <S%H5656><s%> wherein thou wast made to serve <S%H5647><s%>,

that thou shalt take up <S%H5375><s%> this parable <S%H4912><s%> against the king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon <S%H894><s%>, and say <S%H559><s%>, How hath the oppressor <S%H5065><s%> ceased <S%H7673><s%>! the golden city <S%H4062><s%> ceased <S%H7673><s%>!
Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> hath broken <S%H7665><s%> the staff <S%H4294><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%>, the sceptre <S%H7626><s%> of the rulers <S%H4910><s%>;

that smote <S%H5221><s%> the peoples <S%H5971><s%> in wrath <S%H5678><s%> with a continual <S%H1115><s%> stroke <S%H4347><s%>, that ruled <S%H7287><s%> the nations <S%H1471><s%> in anger <S%H639><s%>, with a persecution <S%H4783><s%> that none <S%H1097><s%> restrained <S%H2820><s%>.
The whole earth <S%H776><s%> is at rest <S%H5117><s%>, and is quiet <S%H8252><s%>: they break forth <S%H6476><s%> into singing <S%H7440><s%>.

Yea <S%H1265><s%>, the fir-trees rejoice <S%H8055><s%> at thee <S%H730><s%>, and the cedars of Lebanon <S%H3844><s%>, saying <S%H7901><s%>, Since thou art laid low, no hewer <S%H3772><s%> is come up against us <S%H5927><s%>.

Sheol <S%H7585><s%> from beneath is moved <S%H7264><s%> for thee to meet <S%H7125><s%> thee at thy coming <S%H935><s%>; it stirreth up <S%H5782><s%> the dead <S%H7496><s%> for thee <S%H6260><s%>, even all the chief ones of the earth <S%H776><s%>; it hath raised up <S%H6965><s%> from their thrones <S%H3678><s%> all the kings <S%H4428><s%> of the nations <S%H1471><s%>.
All they shall answer <S%H6030><s%> and say <S%H559><s%> unto thee <S%H2470><s%>, Art thou also become weak as we <S%H4911><s%>? art thou become like unto us?

Thy pomp <S%H1347><s%> is brought down <S%H3381><s%> to Sheol <S%H7585><s%>, and the noise <S%H1998><s%> of thy viols <S%H5035><s%>: the worm <S%H7415><s%> is spread <S%H3331><s%> under thee <S%H8438><s%>, and worms cover thee <S%H4374><s%>.

How art thou fallen <S%H5307><s%> from heaven <S%H8064><s%>, O day-star <S%H1966><s%>, son <S%H1121><s%> of the morning <S%H7837><s%>! how art thou cut down <S%H1438><s%> to the ground <S%H776><s%>, that didst lay low <S%H2522><s%> the nations <S%H1471><s%>!

And thou saidst <S%H559><s%> in thy heart <S%H3824><s%>, I will ascend <S%H5927><s%> into heaven <S%H8064><s%>, I will exalt <S%H7311><s%> my throne <S%H3678><s%> above <S%H4605><s%> the stars <S%H3556><s%> of God <S%H410><s%>; and I will sit <S%H3427><s%> upon the mount <S%H2022><s%> of congregation <S%H4150><s%>, in the uttermost parts <S%H3411><s%> of the north <S%H6828><s%>;
I will ascend <S%H5927><s%> above the heights <S%H1116><s%> of the clouds <S%H5645><s%>; I will make myself like <S%H1819><s%> the Most High <S%H5945><s%>.
Yet thou shalt be brought down <S%H3381><s%> to Sheol <S%H7585><s%>, to the uttermost parts <S%H3411><s%> of the pit <S%H953><s%>.

They that see <S%H7200><s%> thee shall gaze <S%H7688><s%> at thee <S%H995><s%>, they shall consider thee <S%H376><s%>, saying, Is this the man that made the earth <S%H776><s%> to tremble <S%H7264><s%>, that did shake <S%H7493><s%> kingdoms <S%H4467><s%>;

that made <S%H7760><s%> the world <S%H8398><s%> as a wilderness <S%H4057><s%>, and overthrew <S%H2040><s%> the cities <S%H5892><s%> thereof <S%H6605><s%>; that let not loose his prisoners <S%H615><s%> to their home <S%H1004><s%>?
All the kings <S%H4428><s%> of the nations <S%H1471><s%>, all of them <S%H7901><s%>, sleep in glory <S%H3519><s%>, every one <S%H376><s%> in his own house <S%H1004><s%>.

But thou art cast forth <S%H7993><s%> away from thy sepulchre <S%H6913><s%> like an abominable <S%H8581><s%> branch <S%H5342><s%>, clothed <S%H3830><s%> with the slain <S%H2026><s%>, that are thrust through <S%H2944><s%> with the sword <S%H2719><s%>, that go down <S%H3381><s%> to the stones <S%H68><s%> of the pit <S%H953><s%>; as a dead body <S%H6297><s%> trodden under foot <S%H947><s%>.

Thou shalt not be joined <S%H3161><s%> with them in burial <S%H6900><s%>, because thou hast destroyed <S%H7843><s%> thy land <S%H776><s%>, thou hast slain <S%H2026><s%> thy people <S%H5971><s%>; the seed <S%H2233><s%> of evil-doers <S%H7489><s%> shall not be named <S%H7121><s%> for ever <S%H5769><s%>.

Prepare <S%H3559><s%> ye slaughter <S%H4293><s%> for his children <S%H1121><s%> for the iniquity <S%H5771><s%> of their fathers <S%H1><s%>, that they rise <S%H6965><s%> not <S%H1077><s%> up <S%H3423><s%>, and possess the earth <S%H776><s%>, and fill <S%H4390><s%> the face <S%H6440><s%> of the world <S%H8398><s%> with cities <S%H6145><s%>.

And I will rise up <S%H6965><s%> against them <S%H5002><s%>, saith Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%>, and cut off <S%H3772><s%> from Babylon <S%H894><s%> name <S%H8034><s%> and remnant <S%H7605><s%>, and son <S%H5209><s%> and son <S%H5220><s%>'s son, saith <S%H5002><s%> Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>.

I will also make <S%H7760><s%> it a possession <S%H4180><s%> for the porcupine <S%H7090><s%>, and pools <S%H98><s%> of water <S%H4325><s%>: and I will sweep <S%H2894><s%> it with the besom <S%H4292><s%> of destruction <S%H8045><s%>, saith <S%H5002><s%> Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%>.

Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%> hath sworn <S%H7650><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, Surely <S%H1819><s%>, as I have thought, so shall it come to pass <S%H3289><s%>; and as I have purposed, so shall it stand <S%H6965><s%>:

that I will break <S%H7665><s%> the Assyrian <S%H804><s%> in my land <S%H776><s%>, and upon my mountains <S%H2022><s%> tread him under foot <S%H947><s%>: then shall his yoke <S%H5923><s%> depart <S%H5493><s%> from off them <S%H5448><s%>, and his burden depart <S%H5493><s%> from off their shoulder <S%H7926><s%>.

This is the purpose <S%H6098><s%> that is purposed <S%H3289><s%> upon the whole earth <S%H776><s%>; and this is the hand <S%H3027><s%> that is stretched out <S%H5186><s%> upon all the nations <S%H1471><s%>.

For Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%> hath purposed <S%H3289><s%>, and who shall annul <S%H6565><s%> it <S%H3027><s%>? and his hand is stretched out <S%H5186><s%>, and who shall turn it back <S%H7725><s%>?
In the year <S%H8141><s%> that king <S%H4428><s%> Ahaz <S%H271><s%> died <S%H4194><s%> was this burden <S%H4853><s%>.

Rejoice <S%H8055><s%> not <S%H6429><s%>, O Philistia, all of thee <S%H7626><s%>, because the rod that smote <S%H5221><s%> thee is broken <S%H7665><s%>; for out of the serpent <S%H5175><s%>'s root <S%H8328><s%> shall come forth <S%H3318><s%> an adder <S%H6848><s%>, and his fruit <S%H6529><s%> shall be a fiery <S%H8314><s%> flying <S%H5774><s%> serpent <S%H8314><s%>.

And the first-born <S%H1060><s%> of the poor <S%H1800><s%> shall feed <S%H7462><s%>, and the needy <S%H34><s%> shall lie down <S%H7257><s%> in safety <S%H983><s%>; and I will kill <S%H4191><s%> thy root <S%H8328><s%> with famine <S%H7458><s%>, and thy remnant <S%H7611><s%> shall be slain <S%H2026><s%>.

Howl <S%H3213><s%>, O gate <S%H8179><s%>; cry <S%H2199><s%>, O city <S%H5892><s%>; thou art melted <S%H4127><s%> away <S%H6429><s%>, O Philistia, all of thee <S%H935><s%>; for there cometh a smoke <S%H6227><s%> out of the north <S%H6828><s%>, and there is no straggler <S%H909><s%> in his ranks <S%H4151><s%>.

What then shall one answer <S%H6030><s%> the messengers <S%H4397><s%> of the nation <S%H1471><s%>? That Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> hath founded <S%H3245><s%> Zion <S%H6726><s%>, and in her shall the afflicted <S%H6041><s%> of his people <S%H5971><s%> take refuge <S%H2620><s%>.
